name: Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort & Spa

reviews.text: As "locals" we were looking for a short getaway for my husband's birthday. We got a great rate ($109) through AAA the day before our stay. We were not disappointed!
reviews.title: Great Stay off the Beaten Path

reviews.text: Our room was ready at 11:00 when we arrived for early check-in. Check-in was fast, efficient and friendly. He even upgraded us to a pool view at no extra charge. The customer service at this resort was excellent all around.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was super-clean with no signs of wear or previous guests. As another reviewer stated, we felt like the first people to stay in our room.
reviews.title: Great rooms

reviews.text: There are three large pools. Two are shallow beach entry to 3' and kind of warm. The other is larger and there is cold water being pumped into it to keep it from getting too warm in the desert heat. It has a salt-water filter and was clean and refreshing. I tried out the watersilde. It was fast and fun. The kids enjoyed it along with the water balloon toss and watermelon eating contests held poolside.
reviews.title: Fun Family Weekend

reviews.text: They had a live band that played all afternoon and added to the ambience. Beautiful views of the golf course and the mountains in the distance added to the feeling of seclusion.
reviews.title: World Class Hotel with Superb Service, Serene Surroundings

likes.liked: — The amazing location, away from the hustle and bustle, but quickly convenient to Phoenix sites
likes.disliked: — Uuhh! we honestly racked our brains and couldn't come up with anything we did not like!

reviews.text: Okay, first of all, i want to let everyone know how beautiful of a property this hotel is located on.
reviews.title: Great Stay at This Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are great, every room has either a balcony or a patio (1st floor).
reviews.title: The Best in the West

likes.disliked: — Double beds instead of queen size beds

reviews.title: Simply Wonderful
reviews.text: The Kai Restaurant is the best restaurant i've ever eaten at before. (5 star)

reviews.title: Hungry Travelers BEWARE
reviews.text: Beware of this things though:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The boat ride is not open right now, and no one advised me of this when i called to confirm 2 weeks before. They aren't even close to reopening they are still cleaning dirt and rocks out.
reviews.title: Awesome Getaway!!!

reviews.text: This was truly the perfect stay of our recent Arizona vacation. My husband, myself and 2 teenage sons spent the last 2 nights of our trip here and didn't want to leave!
reviews.title: A bit of heaven

reviews.text: The staff were all super helpful and friendly. We requested 2 adjoining rooms on an upper floor, preferred view and had a gorgeous view of the desert. Never heard a sound in the time we were there. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms had a spacious tub and separate glassed in shower. Buffet breakfast in the Kai restaurant was awesome. The lobby and surrounding grounds were beautiful and impeccably maintained. Pool was spacious, well heated and clean. Took a lovely boat ride with an engaging and friendly skipper to the Rawhide western town (a must see if you're there) and the casino.
reviews.title: great get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice midway point between the Grand Canyon and Tuscon - we saw both.
reviews.title: One Of The Best Resorts In Phoenix!

likes.liked: — The free boat trip to the Casino!
likes.disliked: — Don't do Vallet- it is $18.00 per day- we did not choose this option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has beautiful grounds, great rooms and a great pool. Rooms are large and clean. Ask for one that overlooks the pool or golf course (great desert view and sunset). It is geared a bit toward families with activities for kids and large pool area. The spa looked nice but did not use services (was expensive though). Restaurants on property were limited and very expensive but great options and stores a short car ride away. I went for a conference and it was a good getaway place for a few days---more than a few days (2-4) and you could get a little bored. Phoenix is a very accessable town and Scottsdale is also a must do, but again, more than a few days and you could start getting bored.
reviews.title: A delight for everyone

likes.disliked: — A bit to expensive at times

reviews.text: We stayed from 5/26-5/27- and what a stay it was/ I took my wife for a getaway and we arrived and went right to the pool! There is a place to eat at the pool with misters etc. What a place! In the evening we went to the casio which we took the boat shuttle for a great experience (free). Then the hotel had a shuttle to take us back to the hotel after the casino. The breakfast in teh AM was PERFECT!!!! No complaints at all and we recommend this as a 5 star hotel and a PERFECT getaway!!!
reviews.title: Very nice--but way out there..........

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel and had a very good experience. The hotel was very clean - from the rooms to the public areas. We had 2 adults and 2 young children stay in an eecutive suite and had plenty of room. The furnishings in the room and around the hotel were in great shape and in good taste. The local culture was displayed proudly throughout. The pools were plenty (I think around 5) and big. Most were very shallow (only 3 feet) and only 1 went to 5 feet. They were very warm, if not hot. The salt water took a bit getting used to. The kids loved the slide. As it was brutally hot (hey, it is August in AZ), there was not too many people at the resort. The staff was very attentive and service was very good throughout, even though many admitted this being the "down time" at the resort. Rawhide was fun and we visited the equestrian center as well. Too hot for horse riding but the kids really enjoyed visiting the horses. The location is just south of Phoenix and pretty close to most locations. We will definitely stay here next visit to Phoenix.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Great resort
reviews.text: We discovered this resort through TravelZoo, which generally gets its right. The accomodations cost a measly $95 per night although this is August when so many are discounted. The grounds are spectacular. The rooms although small, have several extras. The restaurants are high-end and we weren't familiar with them so only hit the restaurant for lunch. The service was of excellant quality.

They charge for everything; parking, a computer etc so that you have to pick your extras. This is certainly a 5 star hotel/resort and one of genuine refinement. It's a tad out of the way in Chandler, Az but its very near an interesting Indian casino with reasonable table stakes and a good buffet.
reviews.title: The service was great but the hotel was just average.

likes.disliked: — pool cleanliness and not so much for kids to do

reviews.text: The hotel was ok. The service was GREAT! but there's not so much to do for kids. The Rawhide was great, kids love it, the pool was not very clean, there were cups and bugs. The steps going up the water slide was not very clean, there were used towels.
reviews.title: Great hotel - fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was ok but probably i will try a different resort next time.
reviews.title: Loved This Place and Will Go Back

likes.liked: — Ground Floor Room facing West, near Pool. Great location, sunsets, patio w/table & chairs.
likes.disliked: — This so minor. Being on ground floor it would have been nice if the sliding room opened by room key.

description: The Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort & Spa is located in the Sonoran Desert on an expanse of rugged Arizona landscape where the ancient vistas, mountains, and roaming wild horses remain untouched.
